name: Sleep Status (Memory Health Report)
description: Observation-only memory health report. Analyzes access patterns, calculates decay weights, and flags stale content for review. Does not modify anything ‚Äî pure status snapshot. Part of the cognitive sleep cycle.

steps.name: üîÑ Memory Replay (Access Pattern Focus)
steps.description:
Understand access patterns and identify stale content.

1. Run recent_activity to retrieve events from the last 24-48 hours
2. Note which files were accessed recently (active/fresh)
3. Identify files that have been dormant (not accessed)
4. Categorize content by tier:
   - thinking/sequential/: Ephemeral session data
   - thinking/workflows/: Workflow session data
   - Other memory://: Long-term knowledge
5. Create access pattern summary

IMPORTANT: This step is observation-only. Do NOT use read_memory - it would reset decay clocks.

recent_activity.reason: Retrieve recent access patterns without modifying decay state

guardrails.no_read_memory: NEVER use read_memory in this workflow - it resets decay clocks
guardrails.observation_only: Use list_memories for metadata, not read_memory for content

steps.name: üçÇ Status Report (Memory Health)
steps.description:
Calculate decay weights and compile memory health report.

1. Run list_memories to enumerate all memory files with decay metadata
2. Apply tier-specific decay rules:
   - thinking/sequential/: 7-day grace period, 30-day half-life
   - thinking/workflows/: 14-day grace period, 30-day half-life
   - Other memory://: 14-day grace period, 30-day half-life
3. Calculate decay_weight for each file based on last_accessed timestamp
4. Flag severely decayed content (decay_weight < 0.25) for review

CRITICAL: Do NOT use read_memory - this would reset decay clocks and defeat the purpose!

Decay formula: weight = 2^(-days_since_access / half_life) after grace period

Output: Return status report as workflow output - DO NOT write to memory://
Include: Tier breakdown, decay statistics, flagged items for review

list_memories.reason: Enumerate memories with decay metadata (created, last_accessed, decay_weight)

guardrails.no_read_memory: NEVER use read_memory in this workflow - it resets decay clocks
guardrails.no_write_memory: NEVER use write_memory - status reports are ephemeral, return as output
guardrails.observation_only: This is a read-only status snapshot, nothing is modified
guardrails.no_deletion: Decay affects ranking only, never delete content automatically
guardrails.flag_threshold: Flag items with decay_weight < 0.25 for human review
